vectorData.altText: Identify the structure outlined. Be specific.
That's right! This is the glomerulus, within the renal corpuscle.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.

BS – Bowman’s space, space between the parietal and visceral layers of Bowman’s capsule.
PL – Parietal layer of Bowman’s capsule, composed of simple squamous epithelium. Note the visceral layer of the Bowman’s capsule is composed of podocytes covering the glomerular capillaries but is not shown.

Histological image of a renal corpuscle.

G - Glomerulus, tuft of capillaries.
